name: cathode production, LFP, for Li-ion battery | cathode, LFP, for Li-ion battery | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/25307/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg lithium iron phosphate (LFP) cathode for Li-ion batteries. The active material lithium iron phosphate is produced via solid state process or hydrothermal process. A market mix of them is accounted for. Data are based on literature (especially Dai et al., 2018 and Moretti et al., 2019), integrated with expert judgment. For infrastructure, the ecoinvent dataset "chemical factory, organics" is accounted. ;Reference:;Dai, Q., Kelly, J.C., Dunn, J. and Benavides, P.T. (2018). Update of Bill-of-materials and cathode materials production for Lithium-ion batteries in the GREET model. ANL report. ;Moretti et al. (2019). A post-mortem study of stacked 16Ah graphite/LiFePO4 pouch cells cycled at 5°C. Batteries, 5, 45.

The activity starts when the LFP active material and other materials enter the process at the factory.

The activity ends with the production of LFP cathode at factory gate.
category: C:Manufacturing/27:Manufacture of electrical equipment/272:Manufacture of batteries and accumulators/2720:Manufacture of batteries and accumulators

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The time period is from 2018 (year of the publication of data) and 2025 (assuming that this producing technology is still viable in the near future)
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The data are assumed to be representative of the production in China.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The positive electrode is made of the active material (LiFePO4), a conductive additive (carbon black) and a polymer binder (polyvinylidene fluoride, PVDF) mixed in ratio 89:6:5. The solvent N-methyl-2-pyrrolidone (NMP) is used to prepare the cathode slurry. The input materials are mixed to form a slurry, then the mixture is dried with the solvent evaporating away, cut and calendered to form the cathode of a Li-ion battery. The energy required to coat the aluminium conductor foil with the cathode slurry is included in this dataset, because it was not possible to separate it from the energy required for the drying step.

flow.name: cathode, LFP, for Li-ion battery
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

exchanges.description: Calculated value to obtain mass balance.

Based on literature (Nelson et al. 2019, BatPac model). NMP is used as a solvent in the production of NMC cathode. The amount of NMP needed is higher for LFP material than for NMC due to the higher amount of CB (e.g. 6% in LFP cathode compared to 2.5% in NMC111 cathode). Approximately 98% NMP is recovered via evaporation for re-use in the production of cathode material (Emilson, E., & Dahllöf, L., 2019. Lithium‐Ion Vehicle Battery Production. IVL Technical Report). 

Reference: 
Cloutier, Julie, 2015. Est-ce que le stockage d’énergie au Québec pourrait être avantageux d’un point de vue environnemental? Analyse du cycle de vie attributionnelle et conséquentielle. MSc. Env. Dissertation, University of Sherbrooke. Available at: https://www.usherbrooke.ca/environnement/fileadmin/sites/environnement/documents/Essais_2015/Cloutier_Julie_MEnv_2015.pdf
Nelson, P. A., Gallagher, K. G., Bloom, I. D., & Dees, D. W. (2012). Modeling the performance and cost of lithium-ion batteries for electric-drive vehicles (No. ANL-12/55). Argonne National Lab.(ANL), Argonne, IL (United States).

exchanges.description:
Calculated based on literature data published by the industry. For this activity, no information was readily available concerning infrastructure and land-use. Therefore, the infrastructure is estimated based on data from two chemical factories, the BASF site of Ludwigshafen and the chemical factory in Gendorf (which are both located in Germany), which produce a wide range of chemical substances. Based on this data, the following assumptions are made: the built area amounts to about 4.2 ha, the plant has an average output of 50'000 t/a and a lifespan of fifty years. The estimated infrastructure amount is therefore 4.00 E-10 units per kg of produced chemical. 
References: 
Althaus H.-J., Chudacoff M., Hischier R., Jungbluth N., Osses M. and Primas A. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Chemicals. ecoinvent report No. 8, v2.0. EMPA Dübendorf, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH. 
Gendorf (2000) Umwelterklärung 2000, Werk Gendorf. Werk Gendorf, Burgkirchen.om ecoinvent)

exchanges.description:
Calculated value based on Pettinger & Dong (2016). Specifically, this value results from summing the energy demand for cathode slurry preparation with NMP-based solvent, slitting and calendaring, in terms of kWh electricity per cell (0.331 kWh/cell). Original value refers to a 40 Ah, 3.7 V generic Li-ion battery. The specific energy capacity of LFP cell is 0.159 kWh/kg cell (Dai et al. 2018)

Reference:
Pettinger, K. H., & Dong, W. (2016). When does the operation of a battery become environmentally positive?. Journal of The Electrochemical Society, 164(1), A6274.
Dai, Q., Kelly, J. C., Dunn, J., & Benavides, P. T. (2018). Update of bill-of-materials and cathode materials production for lithium-ion batteries in the GREET model. Argonne National Laboratory.

exchanges.description:
Literature. Original value of 56-71 MJ/kWh cell taken from Dai et al. (2017), representing the energy demand for electrode drying & NMP recovery. It refers to 43Ah, 3.7 V NMC cells. This value is calculated considering the average energy demand, the storage capacity per LFP cell (0.172 kWh/cell based on calculations - see parameters) and the share of cathode in the cell. 

Reference:
Dai et al. (2017). Update of Life Cycle Analysis of Lithium-Ion Batteries in the GREET Model. ArgonneNational Laboratory.
